title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: didhetero package provides tools construct doubly robust uniform confidence bands (UCB) group-time conditional average treatment effect (CATT) function given pre-treatment covariate interest staggered difference--differences () setup Callaway Sant’Anna (2021). uniform inference procedures developed Imai, Qin, Yanagi (2023) “Doubly Robust Uniform Confidence Bands Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Difference--Differences”.

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: Get package GitHub:

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: didhetero package provides following functions: catt_gt_continuous(): Doubly robust UCB CATT function given continuous covariate. catt_gt_discrete(): Doubly robust UCB CATT function given discrete covariate.

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: package functions following arguments: yname: name outcome. tname: name time periods. idname: name cross-sectional IDs. gname: name groups. “G = 0” indicates never treated group. zname: name scalar continuous covariate group-time conditional average treatment effects estimated xformla: formula covariates include model. form ~ X1 + X2. xformla include zname covariate. data: name data.frame contains balanced panel data. zeval: vector evaluation points z. gteval: vector matrix evaluation points g t. vector, first second elements indicate g t, respectively matrix, first second columns indicate g’s t’s, respectively. Default NULL, gteval automatically constructed. control_group: units use control group. Options “nevertreated” “notyettreated”. Default “nevertreated”. anticipation: number time periods participating treatment units can anticipate participating treatment therefore can affect untreated potential outcomes. Default 0. alp: significance level. Default 0.05. biters: number bootstrap iterations use. Default 1000, applicable bstrap TRUE. uniformall: Boolean whether perform uniform inference \((g, t, z)\). Default FALSE, uniform inference \(z\) performed. cores: number cores use parallel processing. number available cores can checked parallel::detectCores(). Default 1. catt_gt_continuous() function following additional arguments: bstrap: Boolean whether perform multiplier bootstrap inference. Default TRUE. bstrap FALSE, analytic critical value used. porder: polynomial order used second- third-stage estimation. Options 1 2, correspond local linear quadratic regressions, respectively. Default 2. kernel: kernel function used local polynomial regressions. Options gau Gaussian kernel epa Epanechnikov kernel. Default gau. bw: scalar bandwidth used second- third-stage estimation. Default NULL, bandwidth automatically selected.

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: catt_gt_continuous() function returns list contains following elements: g: group. t: period. z: evaluation point. est: doubly robust estimate CATT. se: standard error. ci1_lower: lower bound UCB based analytical method. ci1_upper: upper bound UCB based analytical method. ci2_lower: lower bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping. ci2_upper: upper bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping. bw: bandwidth. Figure1: list contains ggplot elements analytic UCBs. Figure2: list contains ggplot elements UCBs via multiplier bootstrapping. catt_gt_discrete() function returns list contains following elements: g: group. t: period. z: covariate value. est: doubly robust estimate CATT. se: standard error. ci_lower: lower bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping. ci_upper: upper bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping. Figure: list contains ggplot elements UCB via multiplier bootstrapping.

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: begin generating artificial data using datageneration() function. can see variables’ names dataset : run catt_gt_continuous() function construct doubly robust UCB CATT function given continuous covariate \(Z\): estimation uniform inference results given : figure resulting UCB computed analytic critical value given :  figure resulting UCB via multiplier bootstrapping given :

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: Data generation: Estimation uniform inference: Results:
code: set.seed(1) data2 <- datageneration(n = 1000, tau = 4, continuous = FALSE) UCB2 <- catt_gt_discrete(yname = "Y",                          tname = "period",                          idname = "id",                          gname = "G",                          zname = "Z",                          xformla = ~ Z,                          data = data2,                          zeval = c(-1, 0, 1),                          gteval = c(2, 2),                          control_group = "nevertreated",                          anticipation = 0,                          alp = 0.05,                          biters = 1000,                          uniformall = FALSE,                          cores = 1) head(UCB2$Estimate) #>   g t  z       est        se   ci_lower  ci_upper #> 1 2 2 -1 0.2895654 0.1844509 -0.1664400 0.7455708 #> 2 2 2  0 1.1131381 0.2517058  0.4908630 1.7354132 #> 3 2 2  1 1.6688524 0.2803515  0.9757582 2.3619466  UCB2$Figure #> $g2_t2

title: Getting Started with the didhetero Package
text: Callaway, B., & Sant’Anna, P. H. (2021). Difference--differences multiple time periods. Journal Econometrics, 225(2), 200-230. Link Imai, S., Qin, L., & Yanagi, T. (2023). Doubly Robust Uniform Confidence Bands Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Difference--Differences. arXiv preprint arXiv:2305.02185. Link

what: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
text: `catt_gt_continuous` computes doubly robust uniform confidence bands group-time conditional average treatment (CATT) function given continuous pre-treatment covariate staggered difference--differences setup Callaway Sant'Anna (2021). See Imai, Qin, Yanagi (2023) details.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
code: catt_gt_continuous(   yname,   tname,   idname,   gname,   zname,   xformla,   data,   zeval,   gteval = NULL,   control_group = "nevertreated",   anticipation = 0,   alp = 0.05,   bstrap = TRUE,   biters = 1000,   porder = 2,   kernel = "gau",   bw = NULL,   uniformall = FALSE,   cores = 1 )

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
text: yname name outcome tname name time periods idname name cross-sectional IDs gname name groups. "G = 0" indicates never treated group. zname name scalar continuous covariate group-time conditional average treatment effects estimated xformla formula covariates include model. form `~ X1 + X2`. `xformla` include `zname` covariate. data name data.frame contains balanced panel data zeval vector evaluation points z gteval vector matrix evaluation points g t. vector, first second elements indicate g t, respectively. matrix, first second columns indicate g's t's, respectively. Default `NULL`, `gteval` automatically constructed. control_group units use control group. Options "nevertreated" "notyettreated". Default "nevertreated". anticipation number time periods participating treatment units can anticipate participating treatment therefore can affect untreated potential outcomes. Default 0. alp significance level. Default 0.05. bstrap Boolean whether perform multiplier bootstrap inference. Default `TRUE`. bstrap `FALSE`, analytical critical value used. biters number bootstrap iterations use. Default 1000, applicable bstrap `TRUE`. porder polynomial order used second- third-stage estimation. Options 1 2, correspond local linear quadratic regressions, respectively. Default 2. kernel kernel function used local polynomial regressions. Options "gau" Gaussian kernel "epa" Epanechnikov kernel. Default "gau". bw scalar bandwidth used second- third-stage estimation. Default `NULL`, bandwidth automatically selected. uniformall Boolean whether perform uniform inference (g, t, z). Default `FALSE`, uniform inference z performed. cores number cores use parallel processing. number available cores can checked parallel::detectCores(). Default 1.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
text: list contains following elements: Estimate data.frame contains following elements:  g: group.  t: period.  z: covariate value.  est: doubly robust estimate CATT.  se: standard error.  ci1_lower: lower bound analytical UCB.  ci1_upper: upper bound analytical UCB.  ci2_lower: lower bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping.  ci2_upper: upper bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping.  bw: bandwidth. Figure1 list contains ggplot elements analytical UCB Figure2 list contains ggplot elements UCB via multiplier bootstrapping

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
text: Callaway, B., & Sant’Anna, P. H. (2021). Difference--differences multiple time periods. Journal Econometrics, 225(2), 200-230. Imai, S., Qin, L., & Yanagi, T. (2023). Doubly Robust Uniform Confidence Bands Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Difference--Differences. arXiv preprint arXiv:2305.02185.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Continuous Covariate — catt_gt_continuous
code: if (FALSE) { set.seed(1) data <- datageneration(n = 1000, tau = 4, continuous = TRUE) est <- catt_gt_continuous(yname = "Y",                           tname = "period",                           idname = "id",                           gname = "G",                           zname = "Z",                           xformla = ~ Z,                           data = data,                           zeval = seq(-1, 1, by = 0.1),                           gteval = c(2, 2),                           control_group = "nevertreated",                           anticipation = 0,                           alp = 0.05,                           bstrap = TRUE,                           biters = 1000,                           porder = 2,                           kernel = "gau",                           bw = NULL,                           uniformall = FALSE,                           cores = 1) }

what: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
text: `catt_gt_discrete` computes doubly robust uniform confidence bands group-time conditional average treatment (CATT) function given discrete pre-treatment covariate staggered difference--differences setup Callaway Sant'Anna (2021). See Imai, Qin, Yanagi (2023) details.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
code: catt_gt_discrete(   yname,   tname,   idname,   gname,   zname,   xformla,   data,   zeval,   gteval = NULL,   control_group = "nevertreated",   anticipation = 0,   alp = 0.05,   biters = 1000,   uniformall = FALSE,   cores = 1 )

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
text: yname name outcome tname name time periods idname name cross-sectional IDs gname name groups. "G = 0" indicates never treated group. zname name scalar discrete covariate group-time conditional average treatment effects estimated xformla formula covariates include model. form `~ X1 + X2`. `xformla` include `zname` covariate. data name data.frame contains balanced panel data zeval vector evaluation points z gteval vector matrix evaluation points g t. vector, first second elements indicate g t, respectively. matrix, first second columns indicate g's t's, respectively. Default `NULL`, `gteval` automatically constructed. control_group units use control group. Options "nevertreated" "notyettreated". Default "nevertreated". anticipation number time periods participating treatment units can anticipate participating treatment therefore can affect untreated potential outcomes. Default 0. alp significance level. Default 0.05. biters number bootstrap iterations use. Default 1000. uniformall Boolean whether perform uniform inference (g, t, z). Default `FALSE`, uniform inference z performed. cores number cores use parallel processing. number available cores can checked parallel::detectCores(). Default 1.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
text: list contains following elements: Estimate data.frame contains following elements:  g: group.  t: period.  z: covariate value.  est: doubly robust estimate CATT.  se: standard error.  ci_lower: lower bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping.  ci_upper: upper bound UCB via multiplier bootstrapping. Figure list contains ggplot elements UCB

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
text: Callaway, B., & Sant’Anna, P. H. (2021). Difference--differences multiple time periods. Journal Econometrics, 225(2), 200-230. Imai, S., Qin, L., & Yanagi, T. (2023). Doubly Robust Uniform Confidence Bands Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Difference--Differences. arXiv preprint arXiv:2305.02185.

title: Group-Time Conditional Average Treatment Effects Given a Discrete Covariate — catt_gt_discrete
code: if (FALSE) { set.seed(1) data <- datageneration(n = 1000, tau = 4, continuous = FALSE) est <- catt_gt_discrete(yname = "Y",                         tname = "period",                         idname = "id",                         gname = "G",                         zname = "Z",                         xformla = ~ Z,                         data = data,                         zeval = c(-1, 0, 1),                         gteval = c(2, 2),                         control_group = "nevertreated",                         anticipation = 0,                         alp = 0.05,                         biters = 1000,                         uniformall = FALSE,                         cores = 1) }

title: Data generating function — datageneration
text: Data generating function

title: Data generating function — datageneration
Data generating function — datageneration
text: n number cross-sectional units tau length time series tau > 2 continuous Boolean whether consider continuous covariate. TRUE (resp. FALSE), continuous (resp. discrete) covariate generated. Default TRUE.

title: Data generating function — datageneration
text: data.frame contains following elements. id unit index period time period index Y outcome G group Z scalar continuous covariate

title: Data generating function — datageneration
code: set.seed(1) data <- datageneration(n = 1000, tau = 4, continuous = TRUE)
